content_blocks.title: Advanced Topic Ahead

content.text: You're about to learn Advanced Windows Forensics, an advanced technique used by real-world threat actors and security professionals. This knowledge is powerful and must be used ethically.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Think of this like learning advanced martial arts - powerful, but requires responsibility.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: This technique is actively used in real-world attacks and defenses.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: How would you use this knowledge to improve security?

content_blocks.title: Advanced Windows Forensics

content.text: This lesson covers: Registry forensics, Prefetch analysis, ShimCache, Amcache, SRUM. These are advanced techniques requiring solid fundamentals.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Core concept: Registry forensics enables attackers (or defenders) to deep dive into windows artifacts.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Real threat actors use Advanced Windows Forensics daily in active campaigns.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: What security controls could prevent or detect this technique?

post_assessment.question: What forensic artifact shows program execution?
post_assessment.explanation: Multiple artifacts track execution: Prefetch (last 128 runs), ShimCache (compatibility), Amcache (installation).

post_assessment.question: What is SRUM?
options: System Resource Usage Monitor - tracks app resource usage
post_assessment.explanation: SRUM tracks application resource usage including network activity over time.
